title: A little request from a Braum Jungler
body: I may be one of 3 people that consistently play Braum jungle, but the recent nerfs to him has hurt his early game clear which was a bit of a struggle to begin with. Could he get some compensation maybe? Attack speed?

I'm going to be real with you here-- I'm not a big Nidalee player and I was never a big fan of her when she was in lane (classic 'just dodge the spears bro')... This is my personal opinion, but I don't think Nidalee lane was ever healthy for the game? Think about the play pattern back in those day:

1.) Throw Spear
2a.) Did it hit? Throw another or go in and finish kill.
2b.) Did it miss? Wait for it to come back up and throw another one.

IIRC, Nidalee back in the day was super oppressive with the ahead case, and had a great fallback pattern (AFK throw spears from max distance to chunk the enemy team).

Even now, Nidalee jungle is difficult to handle, she has extremely fast clear, was really healthy/safe, and had great gank/dueling patterns in the correct hands (which is why we have had to nerf her multiple times).

Balancing champions that can go multiple lanes/roles is extremely difficult in the long term health of the game IMO.

Riot Repetoir did the rework (also did Ashe, Ryze, and Quinn)... feel free to reach out to him via Twitter if you want to thank him :).

Out of curiosity (because this is something I've always wondered, but forgot to ask when I last had the chance -- silly of me) -- is there a reason that +/- X% or simply +/- X damage to monsters isn't used more frequently for edge-cases where a champion is interesting jungle viable, yet primarily balanced for other lanes? I'm specifically thinking about instances where a mediocre yet viable top laner is nerfed for their jungle performance, or a mediocre yet viable jungler is crippled due to their lane performance.

I think it would be weird to see that stat on Braum, but I can think of other situations where it might be a REALLY useful tuning lever that I'm surprised we don't see more of.

Hey Djinn,

I'm just shooting off the cuff here (I'm not a designer by any means) but AFAIK;

We don't add damage to monsters for edge case champions as a lot of times, we actively don't want those champions to be junglers (see-- Alistar, Leona, etc). Some champion kits inherently make for GREAT gankers/assisters and we would rather have them on support roles to limit them taking over the game. 

Additionally, clarity could be an issue that I see (for example; if you are a new player and you see Leona does extra damage to jungle creeps, maybe you jungle Leona even though that's super niche rather than the norm and you have a bad time).

I'm sure there's a plethora of other issues I'm missing here, but the TL;DR would be--

We don't want everyone to be viable in the jungle, sometimes it's not healthy for the game (niche picks are OKAY). There are a plethora of clarity, balance and health issues that can arise as a part of this.

Very disappointing design decision to limit player creativity. You should be a  encouraging players to try new shit and new champs in new positions. 

I strongly disagree with you guys trying to shoehorn champions into specific roles And forcing them to play only roles you deem viable. 

I would love to see a viable jungle Leo Alister or tariq one day, and I'm very disappointed that you guys don't want that

The problem is not if Leona or Alistar are played in the jungle. The problem arises when champs that are designed to be good at one thing end up being too good at something else (See tank Ekko, Fizz). Cases where design ends about the same but positive gameplay occurs Riot usually leaves alone. An example of this is Vi being designed as a top lane bruiser but being played primarily jungle. Her gameplay is similar in both cases and she does not cause any game health issues in the jungle role.

I've never seen a Leona tsric or Alistair jungle this season. Obviously I don't then bring OP but I'd like I'd they were tuned to be fair. I would love to see someone pull out these off Meta junglers in LCS for example.


I think the design philosophy of limiting champs or delegating the to certain roles is not so cool. I feel like champs should br designed only based on themselves. Then it's up to the players to figure out how and where to play it

I've done Leona jungle once, its possible to full clear, but she's EXTREMELY slow and you forfeit the first 15 minutes of the game. 

And she needs to be, people love talking about how Nocturne's 6 is a guaranteed kill or other jungle champion's 6's are a garunteed kill. 

But Leona? If she had normal clear speed, she'd be the definition of a guaranteed kill at 6. Her ult range can be used from the bush and if you're even semi competent enough to lane your CC, you'll always get a kill the moment you hit 6, doesn't matter where it is, what lane or who the match up is or even if they are full health when you gank. Someone WILL die. Other champion's 6, not so much. 

The counterpoint some people argue is that Nautilus is similar to Leona in terms of CC, but their ults vary greatly, one is immediate, the other is delayed. People at least have time to react to Nautilus coming out of the bush, you have little to no time to react with Leona. 

I'm all for people experimenting, but there are points where Riot indeed needs to step in and say, absolutely not, certain champions, Alistar and Leona are one of them in which they need to be crippled if they are taken into the jungle. If they had normal jungle clears, they'd be god tier junglers because of how much CC and ease they bring in a gank, guaranteed.
Crippled yes. Unviable no. I want people to play champs in the jungle or support. Obviously I don't want some overpowered new junglers but I'd love to see more Leo or Ali junglers

Which is why the +/- damage to jungle monsters or creeps is not used often. _That_ shoehorns them rather than letting players discover for themselves. 

The idea is not to force them into a particular role, that does somewhat happen as a consequence of natural balancing though. Realistically, no champ should be viable for every role. If they're used for more than 2, they're generally overturned. Each lane provides something slightly different, so if they're good at multiple lanes the champ is bringing too much to the table. 

Lets take Alistar as an example. If he was to jungle again, he'd more than likely crowd out others and have nigh unavoidable ganks. He'd have to be nerfed. This would then make him worse at supporting. The aim was not to force him out of support, it was to make him balanced. But the result of balancing him would make him worse as a support too.

Thing is, Alistar WAS a meta jungler back in the days. But with such powerful ganks, if he's allowed to Jungle efficiently, it's OP.

So either you nerf his clear to ensure that he can't gank so often  -- or as with Braum here, he never has the ability to clear efficiently to begin with.
Or you nerf the ganks themselves. Problem is, you can't nerf that without making him UP in support position. And Support remains his main role, so that's out of the question.

Another possibility would be to embrace the Jungler build and to balance him around that, and supports be damned if he's UP as a result, but that would be kinda strange, and I don't think that's what you're asking for either.

Overall, a lot of Supports create big game health issues if they are allowed to be played outside of Support. They have such powerful utility that if they have the ability to clear the jungle efficiently enough, they can just provide that utility to all the lanes, and it's game-breaking.
